And so begins the long painful process of simming my new spec...
I should get a raidbots sub, lol
Not even joking, you can use their site for free, but premium has lots of benefits
Like the ability to sim azerite essences in the browser without needing to do a bunch of switcheroos and copy / paste of data from the addon
More or less "If I switch to this gear / talent, how will my DPS / HPS change?"
If you use it for free, you have to wait in a queue and your sims are limited in several ways
Like it only being able to try out 300,000 combinations
You can't sim essences in the browser (workaround is do quick sims, but paste the simc addon info with your different essence loadouts)
And your sims can only run on a maximum of 32 cores
10 min later and my first sim is now 90% done
Oh boy, gonna be a fun night, maybe I should save it for the morning! lol

like i said i havent been online since august

When they were moved to WoW, they brought some of the Diablo design philosophy with them, and it's backfired massively
Diablo design works for DIABLO, WoW is a whole 'nother beast.  The game is already massive and grindy and time consuming as it is.
And with a whole bunch of other things included, the last thing it needs is more rng and grind that's designed more for single player top-down dungeon crawlers
yea they need to do some MAJOR work to the game
updating it with stunning graphics and character models is not gonna cut it
i mean yea i LOVE graphics.... im practically obsessed with them
but they need to do major work to the player interface and overall gameplay
story is great, graphics are good, but the old 2004 game build is holding the game back so much
and adding new systems like raid finder and upgradeable gear and new grinding systems just isnt gonna work
So, the engine definitely needs more work (my new computer tanked to 60 - 70 fps in some quests)
But the gameplay is definitely reverting back a smidge

Businesses ran out of advancements and places to make money from in the economy, businesses budded and grew but ran out of space to run when all the markets were over served.
You can’t have 80 companies all trying to make money doing the same damn thing, there’s not enough room in the market.
